div.div: Εὐρυσθεύς : Eurystheus, son of Sthenelus, and king of Mycēnae; by a trick of Hera upon Zeus, Eurystheus was born to power over Heracles, and imposed upon him the celebrated labors, Il. 19.103 ff., 123 ff., Od. 8.363, Od. 11.620.
From A Homeric Dictionary (Georg Autenrieth, New York, Harper and Brothers, 1891)
